Also, @ijuma brought up a good point. Right now, in KafkaConfig, if retention time is set, but MessageTimestampDifferenceMaxMs is not, MessageTimestampDifferenceMaxMs defaults to the default retention time. It seems that MessageTimestampDifferenceMaxMs should default to the customized retention time instead.

looks good to me overall. @lindong28 do you want to take another look?

> When I actually look through all usages of mapValues I could rewrite all of them to be used on immutable.Map (btw, this is reason why I use .toMap on mutable.Map to make it immutable) and there is no need to add "View" suffix to our code.

Sounds good as long as we are not introducing young-gen GC pressure (my understanding is that mapValues does not create new short-lived objects). Looking forward to your final commit!
Please review any of @guozhangwang @enothereska @dguy @mjsax

@guozhangwang Created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4772

Thanks for the patch, @becketqin.  It looks good.

@ijuma, @junrao, do you think we'll be able to fix this soon to get the tests passing again, or should we revert KAFKA-4340 so that we have more time to think about it and get it right?  Right now trunk is broken.

Just dropping by (I look for bugs involving 127.0.53.53!) to let you know that you should probably think about using hostname.invalid for this, it's [specified to be invalid](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2606) rather than .local which might end up with some strange resolving.
HTH
@Sacro @ijuma makes sense to me ... add a new PR for this?

Set up a streams system test on https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka-streams-system-test-pr/1/

@guozhangwang @enothereska @mjsax  - as discussed offline. The one-by-one initialization of state stores was costing about 500ms per store (even if they are empty). With this change the total init time for a test with 10 stores has come down to under 300ms
